If you\xe2\x80\x99re coming into the store on a monthly or bi-monthly basis for dinner or daily for coffee, that\xe2\x80\x99s good for $RH! Moreover, $RH is using normally \xe2\x80\x9cfallow\xe2\x80\x9d space for their F&B business, which is how they also 13/'

b'once every 10 year purchase, but I suppose if you\xe2\x80\x99re a $RH customer, you might be re-updating your space every 4-5 years? That\xe2\x80\x99s a long time between visits, and when you\xe2\x80\x99re in the purchasing frame of mind, you\xe2\x80\x99re probably just going to go with the availability bias of what 12/'

b'Okay, so $RH forces you to walk through a beautifully designed building in order to get lunch or coffee. So what? Well, $RH has basically downshifted its cash & carry business (<1% of the revenues) so how does $RH keep top of mind? Recall that for most people, furniture is a 11/'

b'should stare at it a little harder. So when $RH decided to start a restaurant and install coffee bars, I tamped down on my instinct to scream \xe2\x80\x9cDON\xe2\x80\x99T YOU KNOW RESTAURANTS ARE LOW MARGIN?!?\xe2\x80\x9d and asked myself, okay, why might this work? $RH places their coffee bars & restaurants 7/'

b'this was a very low cost way for $RH to pull you into a membership program, guarantee a certain amount of clients for their internal sales/interior design team, etc. Duh. Okay, so now I realize that when a smart company does something that looks stupid to me, maybe I 6/'

b'it. $RH employs a bunch of interior designers to help you with your design needs, and you get access to them for the $100 membership fee + you get 25% off all full-priced items. What\xe2\x80\x99s going on here? $100 to save hundreds of dollars + you get interior design services? You 3/'

b'The baby wakes me up at 5am these days, so let\xe2\x80\x99s talk about $RH. I\xe2\x80\x99ve been following $RH for half a decade now, and I started off with a profound misunderstanding of the company. When $RH  started its membership program back in 2016, I thought it was a stupid idea and 1/'

b'1/ On March 23rd, near the bottom of the 2020 crash, I recommended 11 beaten down stocks to a good friend.  See screenshots below. I shared the contents of the lengthy text message I sent to my friend in my FB group.  $FB $GOOG $BRK.B $DIS $EXPE $UPWK $NCLH $VIAC $HBI $RH $CWH https://t.co/SjAn70VdYs'

b'Also mea culpa on the fact that I have been following $RH for close to five years and Sat. On. My. Hands. The. Entire. Time. $RH might be one of the best retailing companies I\xe2\x80\x99ve ever seen... \xf0\x9f\x98\xad'

b'because the last thing you want to do is deliver scratched furniture to someone buying a $4,000 couch. Now $W isn\xe2\x80\x99t high-end like $RH but they also realized that they needed to own significantly more of the their logistics channel, and they\xe2\x80\x99ve been adding last-mile capacity 4/'
